operator.name: Bill Speidel's Underground Tour
operator.operatorType: Historical underground walking tour operator in Seattle's Pioneer Square

products.title: Bill Speidel's Underground Tour
products.shortDescription: A humorous 75-minute guided walking tour through the subterranean storefronts and sidewalks buried when Seattle rebuilt on top of itself after the Great Fire of 1889.
products.description: The only way to tour the interconnecting tunnels of the world-famous Seattle Underground! A humorous stroll through subterranean storefronts and sidewalks entombed when the city rebuilt on top of itself after the Great Fire of 1889. The 75-minute guided walking tour begins beneath Doc Maynard's Public House, then spills into historic Pioneer Square — Seattle's birthplace — before plunging underground for an exclusive, time-capsule view of the buried city!
products.pricingNotes: Tickets available online, by phone, or at the ticket counter. Specific pricing not listed on the website pages provided. Children 6 years and under are admitted free.

ageRestrictions.label: Children 6 and under free
ageRestrictions.notes: Children 6 years and under are admitted free, but may find the tour challenging.

schedule: Tours start on the hour, every day

seasonality.notes: Year-round. April-September: 9 am-7 pm (extra tours every half hour June-August, 9:30 am-4:30 pm, sold at Box Office only). October-March: 10 am-6 pm. December 24 (Christmas Eve): 10 am-1 pm. December 26-31: 9 am-6 pm. Closed Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day.

features.value: The only way to tour the world-famous Seattle Underground
Moderately rugged terrain with flights of stairs, uneven terrain, and spotty lighting. High heels not recommended.
Dress for the weather and wear comfortable walking shoes
Tickets available in advance online, by phone at 206-682-4646, or at the ticket counter at 614 First Avenue
First come, first served — arrive early
Public transit recommended; take the bus or light rail. Street and garage parking available in the neighborhood.

locations.name: Doc Maynard's Public House / Underground Tour Ticket Booth
locations.notes: In Pioneer Place Park, Pioneer Square, between Cherry and James Street. Take the James Street Exit from Interstate 5.

locations.name: Historic Pioneer Square
locations.notes: Seattle's birthplace — the tour spills into the historic neighborhood above ground

locations.name: Seattle Underground (subterranean storefronts and sidewalks)
locations.notes: Interconnecting tunnels created when the city rebuilt one story higher after the Great Fire of 1889

faqs.question: Can I wear high heels?
faqs.answer: Be prepared for the Underground to be moderately rugged. You'll encounter flights of stairs, uneven terrain and spotty lighting. So dress for the weather and leave those high heels at home.

faqs.question: Can I reserve a spot on the Underground Tour?
faqs.answer: You can buy your ticket in advance — online or by phone — up to two hours before the start of a tour. Call 206-682-4646. You also may purchase tickets in person at the ticket booth before your tour. It's first come, first served, so we suggest you arrive early.

faqs.question: When are you open?
faqs.answer: Tours start on the hour, every day. April-September: 9 am-7 pm (extra tours every half hour June-August, 9:30 am-4:30 pm, sold at Box Office only). October-March: 10 am-6 pm. December 24 (Christmas Eve): 10 am-1 pm. December 26-31: 9 am-6 pm. Tours daily, year round, except closed Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day. Tours last approximately 75 minutes. Children 6 years and under are admitted free, but may find the tour challenging.

faqs.question: Where do I park?
faqs.answer: Don't! Please take the bus or light rail (metro.kingcounty.gov). But if you really want to drive, there is parking available throughout the neighborhood both on the street and in parking garages.

faqs.question: How many tickets can I buy?
faqs.answer: As many as you want, depending on availability. If your group is larger than 10 adults, or has a significant number of children or students, you can have the Underground all to yourself on a private tour. Please contact us at 206-682-4646, ext. 118, to speak with a sales representative.

products.title: Private Underground Tour (Groups)
products.shortDescription: Private guided underground tour for groups of 10+ adults, corporate events, birthday parties, educational groups, and special events.
products.description: If your group is larger than 10 adults, or has a significant number of children or students, you can have the Underground all to yourself on a private tour. Available for corporate groups, birthday parties, private tours, catering, special events, and educational groups.
products.pricingNotes: Quote-based, no online pricing. Contact 206-682-4646, ext. 118, to speak with a sales representative.

seasonality.notes: Year-round, by arrangement. Closed Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day.

features.value: Private guided walking tour — your group only
Available for corporate groups, birthday parties, special events, educational groups, and catering
Minimum 10 adults or groups with a significant number of children or students
